steps.title: Swipe in from the right side of your screen and tap on “Search.
steps.content: Swipe in from the right side of your screen and tap on “Search. ” Point to the upper-right corner of your screen if you’re using a mouse, then move your mouse pointer downward and click on “Search.”

steps.title: Type “cmd” into the search box, then tap or click on “Command Prompt.
steps.content: Type “cmd” into the search box, then tap or click on “Command Prompt. ” The Command Prompt window will display on-screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Type the following command into Command Prompt:
steps.content: Type the following command into Command Prompt: regsvr32 vbscript.dll

steps.title: Press “Enter” to execute the command.
steps.content: Press “Enter” to execute the command. Command Prompt will display a message that reads, “DllRegisterServer in vbscript.dll succeeded.” If the command does not result in the above message, type the command again and press “Enter” to execute.

steps.title: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message.
steps.content: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message. The program will install successfully without displaying the error message. [2] X Research source Reinstall Windows 8 if the error message continues to display after following the above steps using Command Prompt.

steps.title: Click on “Start” and type “Command Prompt” into the search field.
steps.content: Click on “Start” and type “Command Prompt” into the search field.

steps.title: Click on “Command Prompt” when it displays in the list of search results.
steps.content: Click on “Command Prompt” when it displays in the list of search results. The Command Prompt window will display on-screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type the following command into Command Prompt:
steps.content: Type the following command into Command Prompt: regsvr32 vbscript.dll

steps.title: Press “Enter” to execute the command.
steps.content: Press “Enter” to execute the command. Command Prompt will display a message that reads, “DllRegisterServer in vbscript.dll succeeded.” If the command does not result in the above message, type the command again and press “Enter” to execute.

steps.title: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message.
steps.content: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message. The program will install successfully without displaying the error message. Reinstall Windows 7 if the error message continues to display after following the above steps using Command Prompt.

steps.title: Click on “Accessories” and select “Command Prompt.
steps.content: Click on “Accessories” and select “Command Prompt. ” The Command Prompt window will display on-screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Type the following command into Command Prompt:
steps.content: Type the following command into Command Prompt: regsvr32 vbscript.dll

steps.title: Press “Enter” to execute the command.
steps.content: Press “Enter” to execute the command. Command Prompt will display a message that reads, “DllRegisterServer in vbscript.dll succeeded.” If the command does not result in the above message, type the command again and press “Enter” to execute.

steps.title: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message.
steps.content: Close Command Prompt and attempt to reinstall the program or application that initially triggered the “internal error 2753” error message. The program will install successfully without displaying the error message. Reinstall Windows Vista if the error message continues to display after following the above steps using Command Prompt.
